conclusion: Determine the velocity v1 of negatively charged particles when they reach the collection device.
The magnetic field is perpendicular to the plane and directed into the paper.
Charge-to-mass ratio is q/m = 2 x 10^6 C/kg.
Lorentz force on a charged particle in a magnetic field is F = qvB.
Centripetal force for circular motion is qvB = mv^2/r.
Radius of circular path is r = mv/qB.
Particle source S is at (0, d) where d = 1.2 m.
Particles move in a circular path and reach the collection device on the positive x-axis.
Angle theta is given by sin 48.5° = 0.75.
Radius r can be found using the relationship involving the angle and the distance d.
Using r = mv/qB, solve for v: v = qBr/m.
Substitute known values: v = (2 x 10^6) x (5 x 10^-3) x 1.6/1.
The velocity v1 of the particles when they reach the collection device is 1.6 x 10^4 m/s.
